page.title: 09RELIGION
page.content: The indigenous population of Canna has always been predominantly Catholic and this is still true today. There are 3 churches on the island. There is a large catholic church on Sanday which was last used in 1963 and is presently in a state of disrepair. This church was completed in 1887 when most of the population lived on Sanday. There is a small Catholic church on Canna which is used monthly when the parish priest from Knoydart comes to the island to give mass and at Easter and Christmas when priests come from Abbey School, Fort Augustus. This church has also seen service as a post office and store at various times. There are no practising protestants on the island at the moment but there is a protestant church which was built in 1913. The minister from Mallaig would
